7 Server Admin 7.1 Setup Authentication with SSH keys

7 Server Admin 7.1 Setup Authentication with SSH keys How To Set Up SSH Keys on Ubuntu 16.04 | DigitalOcean Note that ssh-keygen -m PEM is needed for logging into Amazon servers: Amazon EC2 Key Pairs - Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud SSH private key file format must be PEM (for example, use ssh-keygen -m PEM to convert the OpenSSH key into the PEM format) 7.1.1 Login Once the key is generated on the server, logging into a terminal is simply a matter of specifying location of key file and the user@server: ssh -i ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pem bbest@imars-mbon.marine.usf.edu
